main event: A bright, fast-moving light was observed in the sky over Barberton, Ohio on December 12, 1954.
interesting points: The object was circular in shape and traveled at a high rate of speed, making no sound.
A smaller, brighter object was seen traveling faster than the larger one.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of around 6,000 feet.
The witness was outside watching the sky when the object suddenly appeared and then quickly disappeared over the horizon.
The witness had previously seen similar objects in the area that would travel over a nearby farmhouse and then rapidly disappear.
